title: Macromedia
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Companies](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Companies) : Macromedia**

Macromedia was a software company based in [San Francisco](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/San%20Francisco) California that published the popular [type design](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/type%20design) application [Fontographer](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Fontographer). The company was acquired by [Adobe](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Adobe) in 2006.

Macromedia was a On May 9 2005 [FontLab](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontLab%20Ltd.) announced the licensing of the full [Fontographer](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Fontographer) product line from Macromedia Inc. and its further development.

UK designer [Neville Brody](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Neville%20Brody) has received notoriety in part due to his graphic design systems, including custom [type desgn](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/type%20desgn) and [typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20140731010037/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typography) for Macromedia during the 1990s.
author: Joe Pemberton
